title: The AI Team: Who Does What?
description: Students identify different roles in creating AI systems: designer (decides what the AI should do), data collector (gathers examples), trainer (teaches the AI), tester (checks if it works), and user (uses the AI). They understand that many people with different skills work together to create AI.
ai4k12_subtopic: Humans and AI: Human Role in Creating AI
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - understanding AI team roles

title: What is Data Labeling?
description: Students learn about data labeling work: people who look at pictures, videos, or text and label them so AI can learn from the examples. They understand that this is an important job that helps AI learn correctly, and that these workers make choices about how to label things that affect what the AI learns.
ai4k12_subtopic: Humans and AI: Human Role in Creating AI
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - data labeling as human work

title: From Idea to Trained Model
description: Students trace the full process of creating an AI model: (1) identify a problem, (2) collect and prepare data, (3) choose what the AI should learn, (4) train the model on examples, (5) test and evaluate performance, (6) refine and improve. They understand that humans make important decisions at every step.
ai4k12_subtopic: Humans and AI: Human Role in Creating AI
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - end-to-end AI development process

title: Data Curation Matters
description: Students explore how data curation decisions affect AI model quality: what data to include or exclude, how to balance different examples, how to handle edge cases. They examine real examples where data quality issues led to AI problems (e.g., facial recognition working better for some groups than others due to unbalanced training data).
ai4k12_subtopic: Humans and AI: Human Role in Creating AI
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - data curation impact

title: Data Labeling Shapes AI Behavior
description: Students understand how labeling choices affect model behavior and can introduce bias. They examine scenarios where different labelers might categorize the same data differently (e.g., is this image 'professional clothing' or 'casual clothing'?), and how those choices affect what the AI learns. They practice creating clear labeling guidelines to reduce inconsistency.
ai4k12_subtopic: Humans and AI: Human Role in Creating AI
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - labeling decisions and bias

title: Design an AI Project Plan
description: Students design a complete plan for building an AI model, including: defining the problem, identifying needed roles and skills, planning data collection and labeling strategy, choosing evaluation metrics, and considering ethical implications. They document all human roles required and decisions humans must make throughout the process.
ai4k12_subtopic: Humans and AI: Human Role in Creating AI
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - comprehensive AI project planning

title: Design AI for Everyone
description: Students design a simple AI helper (e.g., a recommendation system for books or a homework helper) and describe: (1) who it's meant to help, (2) what it does, (3) who else might use it, and (4) who it might NOT help well. They learn to think about different users when designing AI.
ai4k12_subtopic: Societal Impact: Ethical AI System Design
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - inclusive AI design thinking

title: Fairness Checklist for AI
description: Students create a checklist of fairness questions to ask before building an AI project: Does it work equally well for different people? Could it treat some groups unfairly? What could go wrong? Who might be harmed? They apply this checklist to example AI scenarios and identify potential problems.
ai4k12_subtopic: Societal Impact: Ethical AI System Design
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - ethical evaluation framework

title: Design an Ethical Chatbot
description: Students create a chatbot personality and document their design choices with ethics in mind: What topics should it avoid? How should it respond to inappropriate requests? How does it admit what it doesn't know? They consider different users (ages, backgrounds, needs) and design responses that are helpful and respectful to all.
ai4k12_subtopic: Societal Impact: Ethical AI System Design
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - ethical conversational AI design

title: Build and Test for Bias
description: Students build a simple AI image classifier (using CreatiCode or similar tools) and systematically test it for bias by trying diverse examples. They document: Does it work equally well for all types of images? Where does it fail? What patterns do they notice in the failures? They propose how to improve the training data to reduce bias.
ai4k12_subtopic: Societal Impact: Ethical AI System Programming
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - hands-on bias testing

title: Document AI Limitations: Model Card Basics
description: Students create an AI model (e.g., classifier, recommendation system) and document its limitations in a simplified model card format: (1) What it does, (2) What data it was trained on, (3) How accurate it is, (4) What it does well, (5) What it does poorly, (6) Who should/shouldn't use it. They learn that responsible AI creators document limitations honestly.
ai4k12_subtopic: Societal Impact: Ethical AI System Programming
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - model documentation practices

title: Build Ethical AI with Full Documentation
short_name: AI app with complete model card
description: Students develop an AI application using APIs or tools (e.g., image generation, text analysis, recommendation system) with complete ethical documentation: (1) full model card describing capabilities and limitations, (2) fairness evaluation across diverse test cases, (3) bias mitigation strategies implemented, (4) clear usage guidelines for users, (5) transparency about how decisions are made. This is a capstone ethical AI development project.
ai4k12_subtopic: Societal Impact: Ethical AI System Programming
notes: NEW: Added for AI4K12 alignment - comprehensive ethical AI development
